Package com.group26.node.packet

Class PacketLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.group26.node.packet.PacketLogger
  • public final class PacketLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that stores packets arriving at the node during its session on the server. Also, it is able to determine the missing acks of the corresponding packet given a certain timeout.

      PacketLogger()

      • getInstance

        public static PacketLogger getInstance()

      • addRecord

        public void addRecord​(NetworkPacket packet)
        Locally stores the received packet with a time of arrival.
        Parameters:

      • getMissingAcks

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Byte> getMissingAcks​(NetworkPacket packet,
                                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.Byte> expectedIds,
                                                    long timeout)
        Determines the node ids that did not send an ack to the corresponding packet during the given timeout.
        Parameters:
        packet - packet that was supposed to be acknowledged
        expectedIds - node ids that should have sent an ack
        timeout - timeout during which the acks should've been sent
        Returns:
        the set of node ids that did not send an ack

      • recordLastSending

        public void recordLastSending()
        Sets the last time the current node sent a packet.

      • hasTrafficWithin

        public boolean hasTrafficWithin​(int timeout)
        Returns:
        true if the current node sent any packet within the given timeout
